block.comment: You do not need to modify or understand this script! This simply allows you to use regions of the stage to control the board movement. Connect the script below and try it on a mobile device!
These are simple wrappers to share to with the touch controls above.
This is simply a background. You don't need to do anything in this sprite.
What condition should be checked here?

scripts.comment: Create a command for receiving 'left' and 'down' based on the ones for 'up' and 'right'

block.comment: The main thing you would need to do in this sprite is to fill in the grey functions and complete the script below:.
This is a tester sprite! You should expand the test cases here, by adding items to the input and output lists, and attaching comments to blocks explaining your ideas.

scripts.comment: ============================================== These are your graded test cases! For four out of five of the required blocks you must have 2 different sets of input and expected output. Additionally, each function should have a brief comment explaining why your test cases are good / useful. You are more than welcome to add as many tests as you like, for additional blocks, as long as you meet the requirements above. We strongly recommend that you write tests BEFORE each block!! If you're doing the testing extra credit, (see spec), your extra credit tests should go in this sprite.

block.comment: There are several grey functions to fill out to make this game work.

scripts.comment: EXAMPLES: These tester blocks take in a reporter -- something that you want to test. The inputs are what you would want to pass into the reporter as a test. The output is what you expect the reporter to output when passed in the input(s). The block will report a Boolean based on whether your test passed. Note: You must leave the inputs to the block you are testing empty.

custom-block.comment: For you to run! This test should fail, since 2 + 4 does not equal 5.
This tests that new boards are created with the right size.
This tests whether 5 - 2 = 3, which should report true.

scripts.comment: Fill in what the output should be for the following test case for "merge up".
Fill in two of your own tests for the "merge column up" block. Refer to our tests of "item of" and "+" above to remember how to deal with "merge column up" needing multiple inputs.

block.comment: This test ensures that the item of block correctly reports the items at locations (1, 4) and (1, 2)

block-definition.comment: This is a game board which is expected to be square.
This creates a new empty board of n by n tiles

block.comment: You need to make a list 'result' which contains lists - 'rows'. The value of the cells in the row should be 0 to start.

block-definition.comment: This is just like the ITEM OF block, but for our game board. You don't need to know how it works.
This is just like the REPLACE block, but for our game board. You need to add code.
This returns a new distinct copy of the input board which will help prevent you from accidentally reseting list items.

custom-block.comment: Here's a question: Why is using "map" here an abstraction violation?

block-definition.comment: The block reports the score of an individual tile.
Returns a list of locations in board which are empty. The locations are length 2 lists as [row, col].
